]

<br>
## - The .blue[**Idea**]: altering the members of the ruling coalition `r fa("arrow-right")` shock-proof

--

  - .LARGE[loyalty questions]
--

  - .LARGE[growing outsiders; generational transitions]

--

## - The .red[**risk**]: equilibrium broken; breakdown more likely (Nadporozhskii 2023)

--

  - .LARGE[can introduce uncertainty/fear]
--

  - .LARGE[can sow the seeds of shocks]

---

.full-width-green[
# Media Censorship .tiny[(click authors for non-class redings)]
]

<br>
## - The .blue[idea]: preventing negative signals

--

  - .Large[.hl2[Public information] of poor regime performance encourages collective action ([Hollyer et al. 2015](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/american-political-science-review/article/transparency-protest-and-autocratic-instability/6EE68292EBE8374553FC6407FCA42A27))]
--

  - .Large[If not censored, .orange[elites] could take public turmoil as a 'chance.']

--

## - The .red[risk]: grievance adds up (Huang et al. 2019)

--

  - .Large[Limited to .pink[local] protests, media can 'let the steam out' and address grievances.]
--

  - .Large[Selective censorship: let the criticism be, but don't allow the collective action info itself ([King et al. 2013](https://gking.harvard.edu/publications/how-censorship-china-allows-government-criticism-silences-collective-expression)).]
